_description: Two pages, fragments of a poem about events in the reign of Henry VIII, viz. a banquet and tournament attended by Emperor Charles and by King Francis of France, Henry’s wife Katherine and Francis’s wife Claudia near Calais; a great flood, falling of a parish church steeple during evensong; and of Henry and Cardinal taking wealth from the Dean of St Paul’s and a rich Londoner when they died, probably a continuation of 217 — 33 + 35 lines in rhyme-linked eight-line stanzas, ababbcbc

BodeMus160.First Lines:
…mekill price[ ]tue[ g]rete & wise[ ] gretly
                    doth rise[ ] to vse it weile[ ]it held hym wise[ ]r to fervent
                    ȝeyle[ n]obill prince & ȝynge[ ] chosen Emperoure[
                    ]r of spayne the kynge[ ]agon king of gret honoure& in bothe
                    þe cecelies doth he floureAs king of both god gif hym
                    grace…
BodeMus160.Last Lines:
…By temptacion of a hellis howndhe hangit hym self a deth
                    vnfownd…
